page.title: 04St. Thomas' Church Biggin.
page.content: {St. Thomas' Church Biggin}was built in{1848}by{William Evans}and cost about{Â£1203.}It is built of{local {limestone}from a field near Liffs road which is still called Church Field.To help to keep the cost of the church down the local people fetched the stone with their own horse and cart after work. The{Tower}is approx 30 metres high with a{clock which has recently been {restored.}There is a stained glass window above the altar. A special service was held in{1985 to mark the inauguration of the{new {organ. In{1984 a Flower Fetival}was held for the first time.This was so successful that another was held in {1985}with{LOVE}as the theme.
